description: Evoking a female body through simplified shapes that suggest a head, shoulders, chest, and a wide, concave womb, this sculpture was inspired by a ceremonial ladle created by the Dan communities of Liberia and Côte d’Ivoire. Giacometti appreciated these objects, known as a wakemia or wunkirmian, for their geometry and literal rendering of bodily volumes—an alternative approach to Western modes of modeling and carving.
title: Spoon Woman
